sources.title: The Brother from Another Planet 1984 | Joe Morton, Rosanna Carter (Sci-Fi, Comedy) Full Movie
sources.description:
Welcome to a world of crude beauty... of danger and excitement... of wonders, legend, and imagination... Welcome to Harlem, Brother.
A mute space alien crash-lands on Ellis Island. He blends in with New Yorkers, holds one-sided conversations, and fixes arcade machines. When two "men in black" start tracking him, his new life in New York becomes a chase to avoid capture and return to his planet.

Original title: The Brother from Another Planet (1984) 

Subtitles added on this video (lot of languages)

Director & Writer: John Sayles
Stars: Joe Morton, Daryl Edwards, Rosanna Carter
Genres: Cult film, Comedy, Sci-Fi, Fantasy


00:00 Full Movie
10:01 The video is a collection of dialogues from different scenes of a movie.
18:33 A group of friends discuss dinner plans and encounter a mysterious man.
24:41 A woman named Sam talks about her life and relationship with Bobby.
31:21 A group of people discuss a man who doesn't talk and fix pinball machines in Harlem.
48:22 Two men get lost in Harlem while trying to find a seminar and encounter various characters along the way.
1:03:59 A conversation between various characters in a club, discussing topics such as immigration and the Underground Railroad.
1:15:13 A singer on tour reminisces about her past and contemplates a potential encounter.
1:25:04 A conversation between two people discussing various topics and situations.


@CultCinemaClassics

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2gsu7VGzgdab9LsjsyqpseqaKefjzFvQ

metadata.Plot: The Brother is an alien who has crash-landed on Earth, in New York City. While mute, strongly empathic, and able to fix things, he resembles a Black man with strange feet. His attempt to make a place for himself in Harlem is an allegory for the immigrant experience in the United States. Meanwhile, two bounty hunters from the Brother's home planet arrive and try to capture him.
metadata.Actors: Joe Morton, Daryl Edwards, Rosanna Carter
